meanings.definition: A person who actively opposes or is hostile to someone or something; an adversary.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the hero fought against the antagonists to save the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The antagonists in the movie were determined to stop the main character from achieving their goal.
meanings.sent3: The antagonists in the play were so convincing that the audience booed them during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The antagonists in the debate used clever arguments to challenge their opponents.
meanings.sent5: The antagonists in the novel were portrayed as cunning and relentless in their pursuit of power.

meanings.definition: A muscle that acts in opposition to another muscle.
meanings.sent1: During exercise, the antagonists work against the main muscles to provide balance and stability.
meanings.sent2: The antagonists in the leg help to control the movement of the knee joint.
meanings.sent3: The antagonists in the bodybuilding competition flexed and posed in a playful rivalry.
meanings.sent4: The antagonists in the body are like a team of rivals, each playing a crucial role in movement.
meanings.sent5: The antagonists in the arm help to regulate the extension and flexion of the elbow.
